_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Questions about impermanence, suffering,: But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?
But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?
Seeing with right understanding [sn22.59: You should truly see any kind of form at all
You should truly see any kind of feeling at all
You should truly see any kind of perception at all
You should truly see any kind of choices at all
You should truly see any kind of consciousness at all
The path to freedom (a repetitive senten: Disillusionment with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness
